CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Comments.​Components.​JavadocIterator
public struct
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Comments.​Components.​JavadocIterator

A struct to handle walking through Javadoc/HTML-formatted content.  It moves by element, treating things like tags and stretches of unformatted text as one step.  The iterator assumes you are going to walk through it in a linear fashion rather than navigating a parsed HTML tree.

TokenIterator start,
TokenIterator end
)

Creates a new Javadoc iterator that will navigate between the two TokenIterators.

IsOn
public bool IsOn (
JavadocElementType elementType,
string tagType
)

Returns whether the iterator is on the passed JavadocElementType and tag type.  The tag type is only relevant for JavadocElementType.HTMLTag or JavadocElementType.JavadocTag.

IsOn
public bool IsOn (
JavadocElementType elementType,
string tagType,
TagForm tagForm
)

Returns whether the iterator is on the passed JavadocElementType, tag type, and TagForm.  This function must be used with JavadocElementType.HTMLTag since that's the only type where it's relevant.  JavadocElementType is passed anyway for consistency with other IsOn() functions.

IsOn
public bool IsOn (
JavadocElementType elementType,
string tagType,
JavadocTagForm tagForm
)

Returns whether the iterator is on the passed JavadocElementType, tag type, and JavadocTagForm.  This function must be used with JavadocElementType.JavadocTag since that's the only type where it's relevant.  JavadocElementType is passed anyway for consistency with other IsOn() functions.

GetAllHTMLTagProperties
public Dictionary<string, string> GetAllHTMLTagProperties ()

If Type is JavadocElementType.HTMLTag, this generates a dictionary of all the properties in the tag, if any.

Private Functions
DetermineElement
private void DetermineElement ()

Determines which JavadocElementType the iterator is currently on, setting type and length.

DecodeHTMLPropertyValue
private string DecodeHTMLPropertyValue (
int valueIndex,
int valueLength
)

Extracts the property value from the passed HTML tag value, stripping off the surrounding quotes and any escaped quotes within.

Properties
Type
public JavadocElementType Type { get }

The type of content the iterator is currently on.

Length
public int Length { get }

The length of the element the iterator is currently on.

String
public string String { get }

Returns the element as a string.

TagType
public string TagType { get }

If Type is JavadocElementType.HTMLTag or JavadocElementType.JavadocTag, this is the tag type as a string.  For example, "<br />" would return "br" and "@param" will return "param".  HTML tag types will always be in lowercase.

JavadocTagForm
public JavadocTagForm JavadocTagForm { get }

If Type is JavadocElementType.JavadocTag this is the JavadocTagForm it takes.

JavadocTagValue
public string JavadocTagValue { get }

If Type is JavadocElementType.JavadocTag and JavadocTagForm is <JavadocTagForm.Inline>, this is the content of the tag.  If there is none it will return null.

HTMLTagForm
public TagForm HTMLTagForm { get }

If Type is JavadocElementType.HTMLTag this is the TagForm it takes.  Note that HTML doesn't always follow XML-like rules.  This function will say "<br>" is an opening tag and "<br />" is a standalone tag, but in HTML they are actually both standalone tags.

HTMLTagProperty
public string HTMLTagProperty (
string name
)

If Type is JavadocElementType.HTMLTag, return the value of the passed property, or null if it doesn't exist.  The property name is case-insensitive.

EntityValue
public char EntityValue { get }

If Type is JavadocElementType.EntityChar, this is the decoded character.

Indent
public int Indent { get }

If Type is JavadocElementType.Indent, this is the indent length with tabs expanded.

IsInBounds
public bool IsInBounds { get }
RawTextIndex
public int RawTextIndex { get }

The iterators position as an index into the string.

The raw text tokenIterator is walking over.
